questions.title: Design a Privacy-Preserving Analytics System
questions.prompt: Design an analytics system that measures feature usage while minimizing collection of sensitive user data. Discuss data minimization, aggregation, and access controls.
followups: What data would you refuse to collect and why?
How would you support debugging without raw user data?
How would you audit and monitor access to analytics?

questions.title: Distributed Cache Invalidation
questions.prompt: You have a distributed cache in front of a source of truth database. Design a strategy for invalidation and consistency under concurrent writes.
followups: What consistency model are you targeting and why?
How do you handle cache stampedes?
How do you test correctness under race conditions?

questions.title: Concurrent Queue (Correctness Focus)
questions.prompt: Design a thread-safe queue supporting multiple producers and consumers. Describe how you ensure correctness and performance.
followups: How do you prevent deadlocks and starvation?
When would you use lock-free vs locking?
How would you validate linearizability or correctness?

questions.title: Implement a File-System-like Trie
questions.prompt: Design and implement a structure that supports creating paths and querying if a path exists (like a simplified file system).
followups: How do you handle deletions safely?
How do you store metadata (permissions, timestamps)?
What are the memory trade-offs?

questions.title: Scheduler: Priorities and Fairness
questions.prompt: Design a task scheduler that supports priorities, time slicing, and fairness (no starvation). Explain policies and trade-offs.
followups: How do you measure fairness?
How do you handle long-running tasks?
What data structures support efficient scheduling?

questions.title: Search Autocomplete with Ranking
questions.prompt: Design an autocomplete system for a large dictionary that supports prefix queries and ranks results by popularity and recency.
followups: How do you update rankings in near real-time?
How do you handle memory constraints on device?
What tests ensure relevance and latency targets?

questions.title: On-Device Model Update Strategy
questions.prompt: You ship an on-device ML feature. Design how you would roll out model updates safely, handle rollback, and measure impact.
followups: What guardrails prevent bad updates?
How do you handle offline devices?
How do you evaluate model quality without collecting raw user data?

questions.title: Build a Crash Deduplication Pipeline
questions.prompt: Design a backend pipeline that ingests crash reports, deduplicates them, and surfaces top issues. Consider scalability and signal quality.
followups: What defines a duplicate crash signature?
How do you handle noisy stack traces (inlining, symbol changes)?
How do you prioritize what engineers fix first?

questions.title: Memory: ARC/GC + Performance Trade-offs
questions.prompt: Explain how reference counting (ARC-like) compares to tracing garbage collection for latency-sensitive apps. Discuss pauses, fragmentation, and cycles.
followups: How do retain cycles happen and how do you break them?
What patterns reduce allocation churn?
How do you measure and tune memory in production?

questions.title: Design a Real-Time Collaboration Engine
questions.prompt: Design a simplified real-time collaboration system (like shared notes) that supports concurrent edits and conflict resolution.
followups: Compare OT vs CRDT at a high level.
How do you handle offline edits and re-merge?
What are the minimal correctness guarantees you must provide?

questions.title: High-Performance Image Pipeline
questions.prompt: Design a pipeline that loads images, transforms them (resize/crop), and renders smoothly under memory and latency constraints.
followups: How do you avoid UI jank and blocking the main thread?
What caching strategy would you use (memory/disk)?
How do you test performance regressions?

questions.title: Implement a Mini Regex Engine
questions.prompt: Implement a simplified regex matcher supporting '.' and '*' operators. Focus on correctness and complexity.
followups: Why does naive backtracking blow up?
How do you implement DP and what is the state?
What test cases catch tricky bugs?

questions.title: Design a Secure Token System
questions.prompt: Design a token-based authentication system for a mobile app and backend. Consider token rotation, expiration, and storage.
followups: How do you store tokens securely on-device?
How do you handle compromised tokens?
What logs/telemetry do you collect without leaking secrets?

questions.title: Rate Limiting at Scale (Distributed)
questions.prompt: Design a distributed rate limiter for millions of users across multiple regions. Focus on correctness under failures.
followups: How do you avoid a single point of failure?
What consistency trade-offs are acceptable?
How do you handle clock skew and burstiness?

questions.title: Build a Dependency Graph Resolver
questions.prompt: Given packages with dependencies, determine an installation order or report a cycle. Extend to version constraints at a high level.
followups: How do you detect and report cycles clearly?
How does this change with optional dependencies?
What are performance constraints for large graphs?

questions.title: Design Review: Latency Budget
questions.prompt: A feature must respond within 16ms to stay smooth. How do you design, measure, and keep within a latency budget?
followups: What do you profile first and why?
How do you prevent regressions over time?
How do you handle trade-offs between CPU, memory, and battery?

questions.title: Consistency vs Availability Decision
questions.prompt: You are designing a sync service. Explain a scenario where you prefer stronger consistency and one where you prefer higher availability.
followups: What failure modes change your choice?
How do you communicate these trade-offs to non-engineers?
What metrics reveal user pain from inconsistency?

questions.title: Debugging: Heisenbug in Production
questions.prompt: A bug disappears when logging is enabled and happens only under load. Describe a strategy to identify root cause and ship a safe fix.
followups: What signals do you add without perturbing timing too much?
How do you reproduce issues deterministically?
How do you roll out and validate the fix safely?

questions.title: Design a Fault-Tolerant Upload System
questions.prompt: Design a resumable upload system for large files on unreliable mobile networks. Include retries, chunking, and integrity checks.
followups: How do you ensure idempotency of chunk uploads?
How do you handle partial failures and cleanup?
How do you detect corruption and verify integrity end-to-end?

questions.title: Security + Privacy: Local Data Storage
questions.prompt: You need to store user-sensitive data locally. Design how you would encrypt at rest, manage keys, and handle device compromise scenarios.
followups: Where do keys live and how are they rotated?
How do you balance usability vs security (biometrics, lockouts)?
What is your incident response if a vulnerability is discovered?

questions.title: Design Apple's End-to-End Encryption for iMessage
questions.prompt: Design an end-to-end encrypted messaging system that supports delivery receipts, group chats, and device synchronization.
followups: How do you handle key distribution and rotation?
What about message recovery when a user loses their device?
How do you prevent man-in-the-middle attacks?

questions.title: Design Face ID's On-Device Machine Learning Pipeline
questions.prompt: Design the ML pipeline for Face ID that runs entirely on-device with real-time performance and high accuracy.
followups: How do you handle different lighting conditions and angles?
What about security against spoofing attacks?
How do you update the model without compromising user privacy?

questions.title: Design Apple Music's Global Streaming Infrastructure
questions.prompt: Design a global music streaming service that handles millions of concurrent streams, personalized recommendations, and offline playback.
followups: How do you minimize latency for global users?
What DRM strategy protects content while ensuring smooth playback?
How do you handle licensing and regional content restrictions?

questions.title: Design the iOS App Store's Review System
questions.prompt: Design the system that handles app submissions, automated and manual reviews, and app updates at scale.
followups: How do you automate security and policy checks?
What about handling appeals and disputed decisions?
How do you prevent malicious apps from bypassing the review process?

questions.title: Design Apple Pay's Transaction Processing System
questions.prompt: Design the backend system that processes Apple Pay transactions with sub-second latency and 99.99% availability.
followups: How do you prevent double-spending in distributed systems?
What about handling bank outages and network partitions?
How do you ensure PCI DSS compliance throughout?

questions.title: Design HealthKit's Data Synchronization
questions.prompt: Design a system that synchronizes health data across iPhone, Apple Watch, and iCloud while maintaining privacy and consistency.
followups: How do you handle conflicts from multiple data sources?
What encryption scheme protects health data in transit and at rest?
How do you manage storage for years of health data?

questions.title: Design Siri's Voice Recognition Pipeline
questions.prompt: Design the real-time pipeline that processes voice commands, handles natural language understanding, and executes actions.
followups: How do you achieve low-latency voice recognition?
What about handling multiple languages and accents?
How do you balance on-device vs cloud processing for privacy?

questions.title: Design Apple Maps' Real-Time Traffic System
questions.prompt: Design a system that collects, processes, and displays real-time traffic data with predictive routing.
followups: How do you collect traffic data while preserving privacy?
What algorithms predict traffic patterns and ETAs?
How do you handle data freshness and accuracy?

questions.title: Design iCloud Photo Library's Deduplication
questions.prompt: Design a system that stores billions of photos with efficient deduplication and synchronization across devices.
followups: How do you detect duplicate photos efficiently?
What about handling edits and derivatives?
How do you optimize storage across the user base?

questions.title: Design Apple's Continuity Features
questions.prompt: Design the system that enables Handoff, Universal Clipboard, and Continuity Camera across Apple devices.
followups: How do devices discover each other securely?
What about handling network transitions (Wi-Fi to cellular)?
How do you ensure low latency for seamless user experience?

questions.title: Algorithm: Word Search II
questions.prompt: Given an m x n board of characters and a list of words, return all words on the board.
followups: How does using a trie improve performance?
What optimizations reduce backtracking?
What's the worst-case time complexity?

questions.title: Algorithm: Serialize and Deserialize Binary Tree
questions.prompt: Design an algorithm to serialize and deserialize a binary tree.
followups: What serialization format would you choose?
How do you handle null values?
What about large trees and memory constraints?

questions.title: Algorithm: Longest Increasing Path in Matrix
questions.prompt: Given an integer matrix, find the length of the longest increasing path.
followups: Why does memoization work here?
How do you handle cycles?
What's the time complexity with memoization?

questions.title: Algorithm: Alien Dictionary
questions.prompt: Given a sorted dictionary of an alien language, find order of characters in that language.
followups: How do you build the graph from word comparisons?
How do you detect and handle cycles (invalid dictionary)?
What about multiple valid orders?

questions.title: Algorithm: Sliding Window Maximum
questions.prompt: Given an array and a sliding window size k, find the maximum in each window.
followups: Why does a deque provide O(n) solution?
How would you extend to find minimum as well?
What about very large k values?

questions.title: Concurrency: Lock-Free Hash Map
questions.prompt: Design a lock-free hash map for concurrent read and write operations.
followups: How do you handle the ABA problem?
What about resizing and rehashing?
How do you ensure memory safety and reclamation?

questions.title: Concurrency: Scalable Reader-Writer Lock
questions.prompt: Design a reader-writer lock that scales well with many readers and minimizes writer starvation.
followups: How do you reduce cache contention?
What about fairness between readers and writers?
How do you measure scalability under load?

questions.title: Database: Distributed Transactions with Saga Pattern
questions.prompt: Design a system for distributed transactions using the Saga pattern with compensation transactions.
followups: How do you handle partial failures?
What about idempotency of compensation actions?
How do you ensure eventual consistency?

questions.title: Database: Time-Series Data at Apple Scale
questions.prompt: Design a system to store and query time-series data (like Health metrics or device analytics) at Apple's scale.
followups: How do you handle high write throughput?
How do you optimize range queries and aggregations?
What about data retention and compression?

questions.title: Security: Zero-Trust Architecture for Internal Services
questions.prompt: Design a zero-trust architecture for Apple's internal services and build systems.
followups: How do you implement identity-based access controls?
What about service-to-service authentication?
How do you monitor for anomalies and breaches?

questions.title: Performance: Global Load Balancing for Apple Services
questions.prompt: Design a global load balancing system that routes users to the nearest healthy data center.
followups: How do you detect region health and performance?
What about DNS propagation and caching issues?
How do you handle failover during outages?

How do you communicate with stakeholders?
